Comments_List:
Knowledge:  A great deal of knowledge regarding various aspects of U.S. elections.

Skills:  Mainly analytical writing skills.  The extended bibliographic essay forced me to further develop these skills.

Insights:  I definitely have a better "innate" understanding of U.S. national elections.

Strengths:  Very interesting lectures/insights from Prof Mayhew.  Getting to learn from his is real treat.

Weaknesses:  Not many.  We mostly discussed the content of the readings whereas sometimes I was more interested in dissecting the methodological elements.  That's alright though, it was a grad/undergrad combined class so I expected this going in.
If taught by Prof Mayhew, absolutely, no matter what subfield they are in.  If not taught by Prof Mayhew, then I would only recommend it to other American Politics students.
